AltName.entry: SHEFFIELD BLACK AND ETHNIC MINORITY ENVIRONMENTAL NETWORK

Desc.entry: Enables black and minority ethnic (BME) groups including asylum seekers and refugees, individuals and organisations to engage in environmental activities of all kinds within and beyond Sheffield. Provides guided health walks in local parks and excursions to the wider countryside. Runs a course on environmental photography and a course on orienteering and map reading in the Peak District. Links youth groups to Ranger and Peak Park services. Offers horticultural training via Heeley City Farm and other training organisations. Promotes development and maintenance of inner-city green spaces and advocates for BME inclusion in all environmental matters.

Langs.entry: Arabic, Bengali, Farsi, French, Spanish, Urdu

category.entry: BLACK AND MINORITY ETHNIC PEOPLE - GENERAL SUPPORT ORGANISATIONS
